discussion.content:
All answers are incorrect. The correct output is Account0.Phone=333-878, Account1.Phone=333-878. The original values for records created in the @TestSetup section are available to each test method. Any changes made in a test method are rolled back after each test method execution so that each test method has access to the original values. 
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.apexcode.meta/apexcode/apex_classes_annotation_testsetup.htm

comments.content: this is good to know. can't believe i missed this

discussion.content: None of the answers are correct
no correct answer

All answers are incorrect.
Phone = '333-878' for both Accounts because that is how it is initialized in the method to setup data.

comments.content:
Best I could find is that for going over Total number of records retrieved by SOQL queries - 50,000 you get “System.LimitException: Too many query rows: 50001”

Wording in C would correspond more to "System.LimitException: Too many SOQL queries 101" which isn't the case here

Meaning B and D are correct

choices.B: SOQL query row limit exception due to the number of contacts.
choices.C: SOQL query limit exception due to the number of contacts.
choices.A: CPU limit exception due to the complexity of the query.
choices.D: SOQL query row limit exception due to the number of accounts.

force.com IDE was retired 4 years ago, so while it might have been a correct answer at some point it's definitely not the correct answer right now. 

There are only 2 correct answers in this post

D and E

B,D,E A is Wrong

I almost picked A. I can see why it is a tricky question if you DON'T READ!
we can deploy change set from sandbox to org ,not from org to sandbox
BDE are correct. You cannot deploy change set from Dev org. You can deploy a package from Dev org but that's not one of the options.

Developer org don't has change set option 
so the correct answ : BDE

questions.question_text:
A developer needs to display all of the available fields for an object.
In which two ways can the developer retrieve the available fields if the variable myObject represents the name of the object? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Use getGlobalDescribe().get(myObject).getDescribe().fields.getMap() to return a map of fields.
choices.B: Use mySObject.myObject.fields.getMap() to return a map of fields.
choices.A: Use myObject.sObjectType.getDescribe().fieldSet() to return a set of fields.
choices.C: Use Schema.describeSObjects(new String[]{myObject})[0].fields.getMap() to return a map of fields.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
C D are correct

Selected Answer: CD
I tried, C and D are the correct answers, just need to mention that for D, we need to add Schema. before the statement getGlobalDescribe...
Either there is a typo or either B could not be correct: there's no definition of such "mySObject" thing
C and D are correct
Correct B & C
